name: Summer Pizza Pasta Salad
description: Here’s a pizza party in a pasta bowl! Whip up a double batch because this fresh take on pizza is ideal for feeding a hungry bunch at summer gatherings and potlucks. The best part? Make it ahead of time and let it chill in the fridge. As the pasta cools, it  will soak up all of that pizza-flavoured goodness.
preparation:
1. In a large bowl, whisk together dip mix, oil, and vinegar; set aside.  
  2. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cool water to prevent sticking.  
  3. Meanwhile, slice pepperoni into rounds, if using. Dice pepper and onion. Slice cherry tomatoes in half. Cut bocconcini into bite-size pieces. Place pepperoni, veggies, and cheese in bowl with dressing.  
  4. Add pasta to bowl; toss to mix. Add additional toppings, if desired.
tips:
Bocconcini is a type of fresh mozzarella—feel free to use regular mozzarella if you are having trouble finding it!  

Swap 3 tbsp Pizza Seasoning for Pizza Dip Hot Dip Mix.
